content.description: Just like the name says, this route wastes no time getting to it! Climb the side by side, steep seams in the dark rock on good jugs, pinches, and edges to a steep face. Continue up the seams on super fun moderate steep face\slab to a 5.8 overlap\roof. Once over come, a fun romp up 30' feet of easy slab.
content.location: The route starts just left of the light colored, steep, center wall. It is the 1st route in the dark rock, (it has glue ins) left of the steep light colored wall.

content.description: Start climb just right of, (or just climb the start of) Cactus Root, Clip the righthand bolt, (glue in), follow line/bolts up and slightly left through the light colored rock, (jugs), then up through the steep darker varnished rock, (crux), and up to chain anchors just up and left of the blunt arete.
content.location: This route climbs the left side of the steep, lighter colored wall, down low, then through the varnished, overhanging section up and slightly right. It is located just right of the center wall and Cactus Root, 5.11d. It's the next route left of Cactus Killa.

content.description: Follow the obvious stairway to a short slab, climb slightly up to the left of the small overlap and back right to a final steep wall to the anchor
content.location: 30' - 40' left of "Cactus Hugger", find the obvious stairway on the right end of the Cactus Massacre Crag

content.description: This climb starts on the obvious large Heucos on a small blunt arete right of "Cactus Head". A few steep and pumpy moves lead to a shallow corner, then straight up a headwall, (the lower crux), which sets you up for a nice seated rest on the sloping ledge above. The rest may be needed to tackle the large over-hang above that guards the anchors.  Climb up off the ledge on large unique left-downward slanting \sloping edges to the roof. Climb up and slightly right, easier, (go left for big holds, steeper hero fun) then hand traverse back left for 8-10' on good holds and one final move to the anchors.
content.location: This climb start 10' right of the obvious zigzag trad crack, "Cactus Head".

climbs.name: One Flew Over a Cactus Nest

content.description: Like its neighbor to the right, this route has a really fun, slightly technical start, with interesting climbing up to, (and beyond) the definitive crux just above mid-height on the route.
content.location: This route starts approx. 15' left of "Never kiss a Cactus".  Start on the series of flakes and edges in a slightly shallow corner. Climb up and slightly right thru a shallow slot in an overlap, to a slab and the headwall, (crux), continue up and slightly left to anchors.

content.description: Fun, thoughtful climbing leads to a definitive crux near mid-route
content.location: 15' left of "End of the Cactus", Climb the left facing corner, (use a long, (alpine), draw  on fourth bolt), a fun hold rich ramp leads to the crux,.

content.description: Probably the best route on the cliff with a pumpy finish and difficult clip at the anchor.
content.location: The obvious crack that goes up the middle of the face. I have no idea why this wasn't bolted years ago as it seems like the most obvious line on the cliff.

content.description: A really fun climb up the obvious blunt arête.
content.protection: 6 glue in bolts, 2 bolt anchor with steel karabiners
content.location: Obvious blunt arête on right end of crag

content.description: The climb starts on the varnished slab left of "Cactus Juice". Follow the line of bolts up the well varnished wall to a low angle slab. At the top of the slab, climb up and into a shallow corner\crack\flake system, (a piece of gear .75 - 2 is recommended here). Follow the crack\flake up and slightly left to the anchor
content.protection: Bolts and a single piece of gear, (or two) .75 - #2, & LO's

climbs.name: Cactus Root
climbs.fa: Paul Van Betten, Sal Mamusia, Jim Olsen

content.description: Climb up pockets to join a left facing corner. Climb the corner, then head up the steep wall(3b's) into an overhanging seam which leads to the top.
content.location: Start 20' left of "Cactus Killa", or 20' right of "Cactus Massacre"

content.description: A, or the, crux comes quick on this route. Climb the shallow corner\crack up past a 2 bolts, climb up, slightly right through a notch in an overlap. Continue up to the varnished, plated wall to a seam\crack system that leads straight up to the another crux just below the anchor.
content.location: This route starts on a 6-8" high ledge on the left hand end of the Massacre. There are 2 routes that start off this ledge, this one starts in a shallow corner. You can stick clip these routes from the ground.

climbs.name: Cactus Massacre
climbs.fa: Paul Van Belten, Mike Ward, & Sal Mamusia

content.description: Start below steep gray wall in center of the cliff.

This route is fun from the start to the finish. Start on the crack in middle of the crag, gain holds on the steep face on the right. climb up through a technical crux, (1st - 2nd bolts). jugs lead up the ever steepening wall to the roof, good holds lead you up and left, then back right to the anchors.
content.location: The route starts in the middle of the crag, on the obvious wide, left angling crack at the base of the wall. 20' right of "bbCactus Root".

content.description: Climb starts on the varnished wall just left of "Peyote and the magic stairs" on the far-left end of the Cactus Massacre Crag. Follow the line of bolts up the steeper lower wall to a low angle slab, up and slightly right to a steep headwall, (the crux) and the anchor.
content.location: 8' - 10' left of "Peyote and the magic stairs".

content.description: Climb up onto the ledge, a few steep moves on jugs on the left seam\headwall, lead to a slab and rest. Climb up, slightly right, on ever steepening, beautiful black varnished rock, to a bit of a crux near the top.
content.location: This route start off a ledge, approx., 6-8' high. Its, (currently) the last bolted route on the left side of the wall, approx. 30' left of "Straight to the Point". There is another route that starts off this ledge, in the shallow corner.

content.description: Climb a left facing corner to its top. Move right over a bulge and finish up the corner above.
content.location: Starts 10 feet left of Over a Barrel. Obvious corner\zigzag crack system on right end of cliff.

content.description:
This is one of the best walls for colder months.  The wall gets sun from mid-morning on. There are several high quality bolted climbs in the 10s and 11s than presented in guidebooks.  The neighbor, Cactus Corridor, offers a handful of fun 5.9s.  If you enjoy [Cannibal crag](https://openbeta.io/area/4a219dd8-546d-5d1c-9445-643703914ee9/cannibal-crag), definitely check out this wall.

### Getting here

Cactus and [Civilization](https://openbeta.io/area/bf52d6e0-8d43-5b18-a3d3-bb0cc6ebc916/civilization-crag) (both visible from the parking lot) share the same approach trail.  Follow the right trail down to the wash then climb up trending right (10 minutes).
